intro: Pedicularis tsarungensis, commonly known as the Tsarungensis lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant has a slender, erect stem with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters at the top of the stem. This species is adapted to cold, arid environments and thrives in rocky or alpine habitats.
